extends greenfoot.Actor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera2(greenfoot.World activeWorld, greenfoot.GreenfootImage backgroundImage, int width, int height)
      Constructor for the Camera, used to make the camera Scroll is used at the end to instantly put it in the right place

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getScrolledX()
      Method used to get the cameraOffset (how far it has scrolled) Remember that the accurate world cords of an object is getX() + getScrolledX() (and same for Y)
      int getScrolledY()
      Method used to get the cameraOffset (how far it has scrolled) Remember that the accurate world cords of an object is getY() + getScrolledY() (and same for X)
      void scroll(int dsx, int dsy)
      Scrolls the camera by dsx and dsy (relative to current location)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera2

        Camera2(greenfoot.World activeWorld,
        greenfoot.GreenfootImage backgroundImage,
        int width,
        int height)
        Constructor for the Camera, used to make the camera Scroll is used at the end to instantly put it in the right place
        Parameters:
        activeWorld - expects a Greenfoot.World, used to set what world it should be in
        backgroundImage - set what background will be looped, height will be adjusted to world height, keep that in mind
        width - int value for the total world width
        height - int value for the total world height

    • Method Detail

      • scroll

        public void scroll(int dsx,
                   int dsy)
        Scrolls the camera by dsx and dsy (relative to current location)
        Parameters:
        dsx - int value for how far the camera should move along the x-axis
        dsy - int value for how far the camera should move along the y-axis

      • getScrolledX

        public int getScrolledX()
        Method used to get the cameraOffset (how far it has scrolled) Remember that the accurate world cords of an object is getX() + getScrolledX() (and same for Y)
        Returns:
        returns integer off how far the camera has scrolled from 0,0 for the x-axis

      • getScrolledY

        public int getScrolledY()
        Method used to get the cameraOffset (how far it has scrolled) Remember that the accurate world cords of an object is getY() + getScrolledY() (and same for X)
        Returns:
        returns integer off how far the camera has scrolled from 0,0 for the y-axis
